summary.span: 提供位元組順序的一般觀點。

span.span: Provides a generic view of a sequence of bytes.

summary.span: 這是 abstract 類別。

span.span: This is an abstract class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是抽象的基底類別的所有資料流。 is the abstract base class of all streams. 資料流是位元組序列的抽象，例如，檔案、輸入/輸出裝置、處理序間的通訊管道或 TCP/IP 通訊端。A stream is an abstraction of a sequence of bytes, such as a file, an input/output device, an inter-process communication pipe, or a TCP/IP socket. 類別和其衍生的類別提供這些不同類型的輸入和輸出，一般檢視，並找出程式設計人員的作業系統和基礎裝置的特定詳細資料。The class and its derived classes provide a generic view of these different types of input and output, and isolate the programmer from the specific details of the operating system and the underlying devices. 資料流包含三項基本作業：Streams involve three fundamental operations: - 您可以從資料流進行讀取。You can read from streams. 讀取已從資料流的資料傳輸至資料結構，例如位元組陣列。Reading is the transfer of data from a stream into a data structure, such as an array of bytes. - 您可以寫入資料流。You can write to streams. 寫入時傳輸資料的資料結構從資料流。Writing is the transfer of data from a data structure into a stream. - 資料流支援搜尋。Streams can support seeking. 搜尋是指查詢和修改資料流中目前的位置。Seeking refers to querying and modifying the current position within a stream. 搜尋功能取決於資料流所具有的備份存放區的類型。Seek capability depends on the kind of backing store a stream has. 例如，網路資料流沒有統一的目前位置中，概念，並因此通常不支援搜尋。For example, network streams have no unified concept of a current position, and therefore typically do not support seeking. 某些更常用的資料流，繼承自都，和。Some of the more commonly used streams that inherit from are , and . 根據基礎資料來源或儲存機制中，資料流可能僅支援部分這些功能。Depending on the underlying data source or repository, streams might support only some of these capabilities. 您可以使用，以查詢其功能的資料流， ，並的屬性類別。You can query a stream for its capabilities by using the , , and properties of the class. 和方法讀取和寫入各種不同的格式中的資料。The and methods read and write data in a variety of formats. 對於資料流支援搜尋，使用並方法和和查詢及修改目前的位置和長度資料流的屬性。For streams that support seeking, use the and methods and the and properties to query and modify the current position and length of a stream. 此類型會實作介面。This type implements the interface. 當您完成使用型別時，您應該處置它直接或間接。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接處置型別，呼叫其方法中的`try` / `catch`區塊。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要處置它間接，使用的語言建構這類`using`（在 C# 中) 或`Using`（在 Visual Basic)。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 「 使用物件，實作 IDisposable 」 一節介面 > 主題。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 處置物件排清所有緩衝的資料，並且基本上呼叫為您的方法。Disposing a object flushes any buffered data, and essentially calls the method for you. 也會釋出作業系統資源，例如檔案控制代碼、 網路連線或用於任何內部緩衝處理的記憶體。 also releases operating system resources such as file handles, network connections, or memory used for any internal buffering. 類別提供的功能以提升讀取和寫入效能的另一個資料流周圍包裝緩衝資料流。The class provides the capability of wrapping a buffered stream around another stream in order to improve read and write performance. 開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]，則類別包含可簡化非同步作業的非同步方法。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], the class includes async methods to simplify asynchronous operations. 非同步方法包含`Async`名稱，例如， ， ，和。An async method contains `Async` in its name, such as , , , and . 這些方法可讓您執行需要大量資源的 I/O 作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。These methods enable you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)]應用程式或[!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)]應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 非同步方法會用於搭配`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的關鍵字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 在中使用時[!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)]應用程式中，包含兩個擴充方法：和。When used in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app, includes two extension methods: and . 這些方法會轉換物件中的資料流[!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)]。These methods convert a object to a stream in the [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)]. 您也可以轉換中的資料流[!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)]要使用的物件和方法。You can also convert a stream in the [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)] to a object by using the and methods. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[如何： 轉換之間.NET Framework 資料流與 Windows 執行階段資料流](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-convert-between-dotnet-streams-and-winrt-streams.md)For more information, see [How to: Convert Between .NET Framework Streams and Windows Runtime Streams](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-convert-between-dotnet-streams-and-winrt-streams.md) 某些資料流實作執行本機緩衝處理的基礎資料，以改善效能。Some stream implementations perform local buffering of the underlying data to improve performance. 對於這類資料流中，您可以使用或方法來清除任何內部緩衝區，並確認至基礎資料來源或存放庫的所有資料的已都寫入。For such streams, you can use the or method to clear any internal buffers and ensure that all data has been written to the underlying data source or repository. 如果您需要的資料流沒有備份存放區 （也稱為位元值區） 時，使用来擷取的資料流為此用途所設計的執行個體欄位。If you need a stream with no backing store (also known as a bit bucket), use the field to retrieve an instance of a stream that is designed for this purpose. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用兩個物件以非同步方式將檔案從一個目錄複製到另一個目錄。The following example demonstrates how to use two objects to asynchronously copy the files from one directory to another directory. 類別衍生自 類別。The class derives from the class. 請注意， 控制項的 事件處理常式由於會呼叫非同步方法，因此會以 `async` 修飾詞標記。Notice that the event handler for the control is marked with the `async` modifier because it calls an asynchronous method. [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 .NET Framework 4 (含) 以前版本中，您必須使用方法 (例如 和 ) 實作非同步 I/O 作業。In the .NET Framework 4 and earlier versions, you have to use methods such as and to implement asynchronous I/O operations. 這些方法是中仍然可用[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]以支援舊版的程式碼; 不過，新的非同步方法，例如， ， ，和，協助您更輕鬆地實作非同步 I/O 作業。These methods are still available in the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] to support legacy code; however, the new async methods, such as , , , and , help you implement asynchronous I/O operations more easily. 預設實作`BeginRead`資料流上呼叫方法以同步方式，這表示`Read`可能會封鎖某些資料流。The default implementation of `BeginRead` on a stream calls the method synchronously, which means that `Read` might block on some streams. 不過，執行個體的類別，例如`FileStream`和`NetworkStream`完全支援非同步作業，如果以非同步方式開啟執行個體。However, instances of classes such as `FileStream` and `NetworkStream` fully support asynchronous operations if the instances have been opened asynchronously. 因此，呼叫`BeginRead`也不會封鎖這些資料流。Therefore, calls to `BeginRead` will not block on those streams. 您可以覆寫`BeginRead`（藉由使用非同步委派，例如） 以提供非同步行為。You can override `BeginRead` (by using async delegates, for example) to provide asynchronous behavior. 傳遞`IAsyncResult`傳回值以方法來判斷多少位元組被讀取，並釋放用於讀取的作業系統資源的資料流。Pass the `IAsyncResult` return value to the method of the stream to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 必須針對每次呼叫一次呼叫。 must be called once for every call to . 您可以藉由使用相同的程式碼呼叫`BeginRead`或在傳遞至回呼`BeginRead`。You can do this either by using the same code that called `BeginRead` or in a callback passed to `BeginRead`. 非同步讀取或寫入發出時，不在 I/O 作業完成時，會更新資料流中目前的位置。The current position in the stream is updated when the asynchronous read or write is issued, not when the I/O operation completes. 多個同時的非同步要求轉譯要求完成順序不確定。Multiple simultaneous asynchronous requests render the request completion order uncertain. 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援讀取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果資料流已關閉，或您傳遞無效的引數，會擲回例外狀況立即從`BeginRead`。If a stream is closed or you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately from `BeginRead`. 非同步的讀取要求時，例如磁碟失敗期間，在 I/O 要求期間發生的錯誤會發生在執行緒集區執行緒和呼叫時擲回例外狀況`EndRead`。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request, such as a disk failure during the I/O request, occur on the thread pool thread and throw exceptions when calling `EndRead`.

operations. 這些方法是中仍然可用[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]以支援舊版的程式碼; 不過，新的非同步方法，例如， ， ，和，協助您更輕鬆地實作非同步 I/O 作業。These methods are still available in the 不過，執行個體的類別，例如`FileStream`和`NetworkStream`完全支援非同步作業，如果以非同步方式開啟執行個體。However, instances of classes such as `FileStream` and `NetworkStream` fully support asynchronous operations if the instances have been opened asynchronously. 因此，呼叫`BeginWrite`也不會封鎖這些資料流。Therefore, calls to `BeginWrite` will not block on those streams. 您可以覆寫`BeginWrite`（藉由使用非同步委派，例如） 以提供非同步行為。You can override `BeginWrite` (by using async delegates, for example) to provide asynchronous behavior. 傳遞`IAsyncResult`目前的方法來傳回以確保寫入完成，並適當地釋放資源。Pass the `IAsyncResult` returned by the current method to to ensure that the write completes and frees resources appropriately. 必須針對每次呼叫一次呼叫。 must be called once for every call to . 您可以藉由使用相同的程式碼呼叫`BeginWrite`或在傳遞至回呼`BeginWrite`。You can do this either by using the same code that called `BeginWrite` or in a callback passed to `BeginWrite`. 如果在非同步寫入期間發生錯誤，將不會擲回例外狀況之前`EndWrite`呼叫`IAsyncResult`這個方法所傳回。If an error occurs during an asynchronous write, an exception will not be asynchronous requests render the request completion order uncertain. 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援寫入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果資料流已關閉，或您傳遞無效的引數，會擲回例外狀況立即從`BeginWrite`。If a stream is closed or you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately from `BeginWrite`. 非同步寫入要求，例如磁碟失敗期間，在 I/O 要求期間發生的錯誤會發生在執行緒集區執行緒和呼叫時擲回例外狀況`EndWrite`。Errors that occur during an asynchronous write request, such as a disk failure during the I/O request, occur on the thread pool thread and throw exceptions summary.span: 關閉目前資料流和釋放與目前資料流相關聯的任何資源 (例如通訊端和檔案控制代碼)。

summary.span: 請確定正確地處置資料流，而非呼叫這個方法。

span.span: Instead of calling this method, ensure that the stream is properly disposed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會呼叫，並指定`true`釋放所有資源。This method calls , specifying `true` to release all resources. 您不必特別呼叫方法。You do not have to specifically call the method. 相反地，請確認每個正確處置物件。Instead, ensure that every object is properly disposed. 您可以宣告內的物件`using`區塊 (或`Using`封鎖在 Visual Basic 中) 以確保會處置資料流和其所有資源，或您可以明確呼叫方法。You can declare objects within a `using` block (or `Using` block in Visual Basic) to ensure that the stream and all of its resources are disposed, or you can explicitly call the method. 除非您明確地呼叫的實作，排清資料流不會清除它的基礎編碼器或`Close`。Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call an implementation of or `Close`. 設定至`true`表示資料會從排清緩衝區資料流，但並不會清除編碼器的狀態。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 這可讓編碼器，讓它可以正確編碼字元的下一個區塊保持其狀態 （部分的字元）。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 這個案例會影響 UTF8，UTF7，其中某些字元可以編碼的編碼器接收或多個相鄰的字元時，才。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can be encoded only after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. 嘗試在關閉資料流之後，管理資料流可能會擲回。Attempts to manipulate the stream after the stream has been closed might throw an .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您執行需要大量資源的 I/O 作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 應用程式或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 非同步方法會用於搭配`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的關鍵字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 在目前資料流目前位置開始複製。Copying begins at the current position in the current stream. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用兩個要以非同步方式將檔案從一個目錄複製到另一個物件。The following example demonstrates how to use two objects to asynchronously copy the files from one directory to another. 類別衍生自 類別。The class derives from the class. 請注意，事件處理常式控制項，會以標記`async`修飾詞因為它會呼叫非同步方法Notice that the event handler for the control is marked with the `async` modifier because it calls an asynchronous method [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example.vb#1)]

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您應該釋放所有資源，藉由指定`true`針對`disposing`。You should release all resources by specifying `true` for `disposing`. 當`disposing`是`true`，資料會排清基礎緩衝區中，並存取其他可完成的物件，也可以確保資料流。When `disposing` is `true`, the stream can also ensure data is flushed to the underlying buffer, and access other finalizable objects. 這不可能來自因為缺乏順序完成項完成項呼叫時。This may not be possible when called from a finalizer due a lack of ordering among finalizers. 如果您的資料流使用的作業系統控制代碼和它的來源進行通訊，請考慮使用的子類別針對此目的。If your stream is using an operating system handle to communicate with its source, consider using a subclass of for this purpose. 這個方法會呼叫公用方法和方法。This method is called by the public method and the method. 叫用受保護方法`disposing`參數設為`true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 叫用具有`disposing`設定為`false`。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`.

para.span: 在衍生類別中，不會覆寫方法，而是將所有中的 Stream 清除邏輯方法。

span.span: In derived classes, do not override the method, instead, put all of the Stream cleanup logic in the method.

para.span: 可以被其他物件呼叫多次。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 覆寫 時，請小心不要參考到先前已在對 的早期呼叫中被處置 (Dispose) 的物件。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 如需有關如何實作，請參閱 <<c2> [ 實作 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 .NET Framework 4 (含) 以前版本中，您必須使用方法 (例如 和 ) 實作非同步 I/O 作業。In the .NET Framework 4 and earlier versions, you have to use methods such as and to implement asynchronous I/O operations. 這些方法是中仍然可用[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]以支援舊版的程式碼; 不過，新的非同步方法，例如， ， ，和，協助您更輕鬆地實作非同步 I/O 作業。These methods are still available in the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] to support legacy code; however, the new async methods, such as , , , and , help you implement asynchronous I/O operations more easily. `EndWrite` 必須正好一次上呼叫每個從。`EndWrite` must be called exactly once on every from . 這個方法會封鎖，直到 I/O 作業完成為止。This method blocks until the I/O operation has completed. 非同步寫入要求，例如磁碟失敗期間，在 I/O 要求期間發生的錯誤在執行緒集區執行緒上發生，並呼叫時變成可見`EndWrite`。Errors that occur during an asynchronous write request, such as a disk failure during the I/O request, occur on the thread pool thread and become visible upon a call to `EndWrite`. 執行緒集區執行緒擲回例外狀況時呼叫，將無法看到`EndWrite`。Exceptions thrown by the thread pool thread will not be visible when calling `EndWrite`.

summary.span: 當在衍生類別中覆寫時，會清除這個資料流的所有緩衝區，並造成所有緩衝資料都寫入基礎裝置。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 覆寫`Flush`實作緩衝區的資料流。Override `Flush` on streams that implement a buffer. 若要將任何資訊從基礎緩衝區移到其目的地，請清除緩衝區，或兩者都使用這個方法。Use this method to move any information from an underlying buffer to its destination, clear the buffer, or both. 物件的狀態而定，您可能必須修改資料流中目前的位置 （例如，如果基礎資料流支援搜尋）。Depending upon the state of the object, you might have to modify the current position within the stream (for example, if the underlying stream supports seeking). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For additional information see . 從衍生類別中，不支援寫入，通常會實作為空的方法，以確保完整的相容性與其他類型，因為它是有效排清的唯讀資料流。In a class derived from that doesn't support writing, is typically implemented as an empty method to ensure full compatibility with other types since it's valid to flush a read-only stream. 使用時或是類別中，不會排清基底物件。When using the or class, do not flush the base object. 相反地，使用該類別的或方法，以確保資料第一次排清基礎資料流，並接著會寫入至檔案。Instead, use the class's or method, which makes sure that the data is flushed to the underlying stream first and then written to the file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援讀取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 使用方法以非同步方式讀取自目前資料流。Use the method to read asynchronously from the current stream. 此方法的實作讀取最多`count`從目前的位元組資料流，並將其在存放`buffer`開始`offset`。Implementations of this method read a maximum of `count` bytes from the current stream and store them in `buffer` beginning at `offset`. 資料流目前位置前移讀取; 的位元組數目不過，如果發生例外狀況，資料流中目前的位置會保持不變。The current position within the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read; however, if an exception occurs, the current position within the stream remains unchanged. 實作會傳回讀取的位元組數目。Implementations return the number of bytes read. 實作將會封鎖直到至少一個位元組的資料可以讀取，，沒有資料可供使用。The implementation will block until at least one byte of data can be read, in the event that no data is available. 只有當資料流中沒有詳細資料，而且超過預期 （例如已關閉通訊端或檔案結尾中） 時，會傳回 0。 returns 0 only when there is no more data in the stream and no more is expected (such as a closed socket or end of file). 實作可以自由地傳回比要求更少個位元組，即使尚未達到資料流結尾。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. 使用讀取基本資料型別。Use for reading primitive data types. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用讀取資料區塊。The following example shows how to use to read a block of data. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您執行需要大量資源的 I/O 作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 應用程式或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 非同步方法會用於搭配`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的關鍵字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援讀取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何以非同步方式從檔案讀取。The following example shows how to read from a file asynchronously. 此範例會使用類別，衍生自類別。The example uses the class, which derives from the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援搜尋。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports seeking. 如果`offset`是負數，新的位置，才可由指定的位置之前`origin`所指定的位元組數`offset`。If `offset` is negative, the new position is required to precede the position specified by `origin` by the number of bytes specified by `offset`. 如果`offset`為零 (0)、 新的位置是一定要指定的位置`origin`。If `offset` is zero (0), the new position is required to be the position specified by `origin`. 如果`offset`為正數，則新的位置，才能遵循所指定的位置`origin`所指定的位元組數`offset`。If `offset` is positive, the new position is required to follow the position specified by `origin` by the number of bytes specified by `offset`. 類別衍生自`Stream`支援搜尋必須覆寫此方法以提供上面所述的功能。Classes derived from `Stream` that support seeking must override this method to provide the functionality described above. 支援搜尋超過資料流長度的任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is supported.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您執行需要大量資源的 I/O 作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 應用程式或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 非同步方法會用於搭配`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的關鍵字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援寫入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果在作業取消之前完成，傳回的工作就會包含值屬性。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property. 如需範例，請參閱多載。For an example, see the overload.
